text: The 1908 Italian Athletics Championships were held in Rome. it was the 3rd edition of the Italian Athletics Championships. ==Champions== {| class="wikitable" width=45% style="font-size:100%; text-align:center;" |-align=center !Event !!Athlete!!Performance |- |align=left|100 m ||align=left|Umberto Barozzi || 11.2 |- |align=left|400 m ||align=left|Emilio Lunghi || 52.5 |- |align=left|1000 m ||align=left|Emilio Lunghi || 2.31.0 |- |align=left|5000 m ||align=left|Pericle Pagliani || 16:07.8 |- |align=left| ||align=left|Dorando Pietri || 1.10:54.6 |- |align=left|Marathon (40 km track) ||align=left|Umberto Blasi || 3:01:04 |- |align=left|110 m hurdles ||align=left|Alfredo Pagani || 16.6 |- |align=left|1200 m steeplechase ||align=left|Massimo Cartasegna || 3:46.2 |- |align=left|1500 m walk ||align=left|Pietro Fontana || 6:42.0 |- |align=left|10,000 m walk ||align=left|Angelo Claro || 50:52.8 |- |align=left|40 km walk track||align=left|Antonio Navoni || 4:07:37 |- |align=left|Cross country running (12 km)||align=left|Pericle Pagliani || 49:12 |} == References == == External links == * Italian Athletics Federation Italian Athletics Championships Category:Italian Athletics Outdoor Championships Category:1908 in Italian sport
title: 1908 Italian Athletics Championships
